problem_summary_simple: Convert an Excel column title string (like 'A', 'AA') to its corresponding number.
problem_summary_technical: Treats the column title as a base-26 number system, converting characters to their numerical values and summing them with appropriate powers of 26.
key_insights: The problem is analogous to converting a number from a different base (base-26) to base-10.
Each character's value is its position in the alphabet (A=1, B=2, ... Z=26).
The calculation involves multiplying the current result by 26 before adding the new character's value.
